channel.description: Recent content in book on rs.io

item.title: “The Ask” is an Entrepreneur’s Core Skill
item.description:
+ Other Notes on Entrepreneurial Expertise

I’ve been going through the second edition of the Cambridge Handbook of Expertise after reading the first years ago, and was delighted to find the new edition has a chapter on excellence among entrepreneurs.

Some highlights:

item.title: Book Review: A Random Walk Down Wall Street
item.description: _(Note: this review originally appeared on a sister-site I’m building out, Top Financial Advisor, but I’m cross-posting it for readers here, as part of my ongoing book reviews.

item.title: Review and Summary: Advertising Secrets of the Written Word
item.description: I made you a promise. I promised that book reviews were going to become a regular thing around here — you know, in my Born to Run review and summary, where I said: “I plan for this to be the first in a very long tradition of reviewing books, so stay tuned for more.

item.title: Born to Run: Book Review and Summary
item.description: I’m training for a half-marathon. As someone not terribly athletically gifted, it’s been slow-going.

item.title: Hard Books Are Overrated
item.description: Hot air balloons take people on adventures. Books do, too.

item.title: Categories for the Working Philosopher
item.description: Elaine Landry is working on putting together a book, Categories for the Working Philosopher.

item.title: Book Summary: The Pursuit of Happiness
item.description: This is a review and summary of David Myers’s The Pursuit of Happiness.
